Name: Too Many Bones: Polaris
Description:
A new gearloc for Too Many Bones from TMB: Unbreakable Gamefound campaign.

1 gearloc chip
21 dice
1 reference sheet
1 gearloc mat

Name: Too Many Bones: Static
Description:
A new gearloc for Too Many Bones from TMB: Unbreakable Gamefound campaign.

1 gearloc chip
21 dice
1 reference sheet
1 gearloc mat

Name: Too Many Bones: Carcass
Description:
A new gearloc for Too Many Bones from TMB: Unbreakable Gamefound campaign.

1 gearloc chip
21 dice
1 reference sheet
1 gearloc mat
1 cook book

Name: Too Many Bones: 40 Waves in Daelore
Description:
specifically designed for Too Many Bones: Undertow.
Mix up your Too Many Bones: Undertow' games with a raft of new encounters and Baddies.

40 encounter cards
16 baddie chips

Name: Antietam
Description:
Antietam is a Grand-Tactical introductory board-wargame at the brigade level of the bloodiest single day (September 17, 1862) of the American Civil War.

–Description from the publisher

Name: CanDados
Description:
Roll the Dice! Open Padlocks! Get Goals! Avoid challenges!

CanDados is a fun game of cards and dice,a push your luck game in which you must manage to open the padlocks of your objectives in order to obtain the score they contain.

Use the action of the special dice to achieve your objectives or annoy your opponents.

Get target cards by rolling the dice. Only one target per turn

On your turn, roll the 5 dice and try to get one of your target cards in 3 rolls. You can roll the number of dice you want in each roll, setting aside the dice that you want to keep, these dice can be re-rolled in the next pending rolls. At the end of your rolls, you can set aside a die with a 1 and then perform its special action (The removed die will not count towards your objective).

Special challenges may also help you get target cards.

The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.



¡Lanza los Dados! ¡Abre Candados! ¡Consigue Objetivos! ¡Evita desafíos!CanDados es un divertido juego de cartas y dados en el que deberás conseguir abrir los candados de tus objetivos para poder obtener la puntuación que encierran.

Usa la acción de los dados especiales para lograr tus objetivos o fastidiar a tus adversarios.

Consigue cartas objetivo tirando los dados. Un único objetivo por turno.

Gana el jugador que más puntos obtenga al final de la partida.

Lanza los 5 dados e intenta conseguir una de tus cartas objetivo en 3 tiradas. Puedes lanzar el número de dados que desees en cada tirada, apartando los dados que quieras guardar, dichos dados pueden volver a relanzarse en la siguientes tiradas pendientes. Al finalizar tus tiradas puedes apartar un dado con un 1 y posteriormente realizar su acción especial (El dado apartado no contará para tu objetivo). Ver dados especiales para saber sus acciones.

Name: Smash Up: Tournoi TITANS Saison 2
Description:
Included Faction Titans:

     Wizards (Original)
     Giant Ants (Monster Smash)
     Werewolves (Monster Smash)
     Vampires (Monster Smash)
     Fairies (Pretty Pretty Smash Up)
     Changerbots (Cease and Desist)
     Ignobles (Cease and Desist)
     Explorers (What Were We Thinking)

Name: Smash Up: Tournoi TITANS Saison 1
Description:
Included Faction Titans:

     Innsmouth (Obligatory Cthulhu)
     Time Traveler (Science Fiction Double Feature)
     Ghosts (Awesome Level 9000)
     Minion of Cthulhu (Obligatory Cthulhu)
     Pirates (Original)
     Bear Cavalry (Awesome Level 9000)
     Tricksters (Original)
     Super Spies (Science Fiction Double Feature)

Name: Das Bankett: Teil 2 – Der Fluch des Diamanten von Ramanpur
Description:
This a cooperative detective story!
From the beginning of the game you get all information (newspaper, interviews, links to websites etc.) and then you have to solve the case!

Although the robbery of the Ramanpur diamond was cleared up after the banquet, some puzzles remain unsolved. An illness afflicts the kitchen staff, an inexplicable red fog covers the hotel grounds and finally the von Schwarzburg twins have to undergo psychiatric treatment after they have mysteriously disappeared.
Are these events related to the curse of the diamond?

According to legend, the diamond curses anyone who gets hold of it. Uncover if there are indeed higher forces at work here or if there is a logical explanation for all events.

Name: Auksinis protas: Startas Nr. 1
Description:
The game consists of 100 cards with 200 questions, an answer book and 10 joker cards, of which the TV game hosts - ArÅ«nas Valinskas and Andrius Tapinas - will give the players fun QR tasks. You can compete one on one or form teams and embark on a real intelligence fight.
The game begins with the first round of cards (1 to 50 cards and with 5 joker cards) to be shuffled and folded on the table. Cards are drawn in turn, questions are read aloud. If the game is a team based, team members can consult with each other. Answers are checked by the opponent or the opposing team. After playing the first round, the second is played on the same principle (from 51 to 100 cards and with 5 joker cards).
1 point is awarded for the correct answer. For proper performance of the joker's task - 3 points. For transferring a joker card to another player (or team) without reading the QR code - 0 points. After scanning the QR code of a missed task, 1 point is deducted. The participant or team with the most points wins.

The cards can be used as a stand-alone game or as an expansion for "Golden Mind: a great board game". Also, this game can be expanded with "Golden Mind. Start No. 2" cards.

Name: Der Fluch des Waldes II (fan expansion for The Adventures of Robin Hood)
Description:
With this adventure booklet you can experience another exciting adventure of Robin Hood and his companions. It plays around the same time as chapter 4. The story of the adventure plays independently of the others and therefore no prior knowledge of other chapters is necessary.

Since new elements and tiles from later adventures have been added, it is recommended that you have already played the basic game. All outlaws already have their own special abilities. The functions for new items can be found on the following page. No prior knowledge of this adventure is required.

Robin and his friends took the injured Guardian to the secret camp and were concerned if he would survive this unpredictable onslaught. Robin paced frantically, pondering who was behind this evil could. Because only he can save the keeper so that he can recover. It was clear that the Sheriff of Nottingham must be behind this curse, for the sheriff had been following her for a long time. The forest was a good hiding place and the guards always had great difficulty finding them. Suddenly voices were heard nearby. The sheriff's guards were alarmed, because Nottingham was swarming with soldiers.
Families: Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Robin Hood

Name: Rafty Ride
Description:
You wake up on a desolate island, your clothes are soaked & the last thing you remember is looking out your ships’ deck as a storm tossed it about in the ocean. Far to the east of the island, you see your cargo of colourful rafts gently nudging the shore. The adventurer in you awakens!

On your turn each player gets 3 actions: Dice Roll, Path Bending and Movement. Based on the colours rolled on the first action the player can choose rafts for the next action where they place and remove rafts from anyones path. The player can either move free to a raft of the same colour or roll a Draft to move to a raft of another colour. Attack other players by rolling any colour doubles and skip a raft on double draft.

Create your own path by building, breaking & jumping across the colourful rafts to make your way back to the Shore. The first player to reach shore wins the game!

Roll the dice to test your luck in this sweet and brutal game.

Name: Pagan: Beyond the Palisades
Description:
Pagan: Beyond the Palisades is the first expansion for Pagan: Fate of Roanoke.

Pagan is an asymmetrical card game for two players taking on the roles of Witch or Witch hunter. The Witch tries to carry out a ritual of renaturation before being exposed and eliminated by the Witch hunter. Nine villagers are under suspicion and only the Witch player knows who the real Witch is. Each turn, the players use their action pawns on active villagers to draw cards, play cards, gain influence and manage the Gloom. Moreover, the Witch can brew powerful potions, improve their familiar and cast enchantments and charms, while the Witch hunter enlists allies, claim strategic locations, and ruthlessly investigates the villagers.

Beyond the Palisades introduces two new mechanics to Pagan: Gloom and Cleanse.
Gloom is a new resource that benefits the Witch player as long as it is in play. It symbolizes the Witch's symbiotic
relationship with the lands. Gloom enters the game through the play of Gloom-cards and can be reduced or increased
during a game. Some cards can even break the natural limits of the Gloom on the cards.
With sufficient effort and focus, it is possible to cleanse the Gloom encroaching on the village. Cleansing a card is done
by removing every last bit of Gloom. Once a card is cleansed it is discarded.

Content
The game features 4 scenarios, 9 all new villagers, 30 Gloom tokens and 2 full pre-made decks for each player (50 cards each).

Name: Smarter than a Monkey
Description:
A quiz game for the whole family where the question goes to the one who bets the highest! All questions are written in a manner where you have 4 alternatives that are true or false. A Monkey would on average get 2 right. So you need to have 3 out of 4 to be Smarter than a Monkey.

The questions are revealed in parts and you bet bananas to gain the right to answer the question. If your answer is correct you win the bananas. Most bananas in the end wins! The base game can be expanded with question expansions. Along with this first version, one expansion will be made available: Smarter than a Monkey - The Solar System.

Name: KrimiGames Case 1: La Famiglia
Description:
This a cooperative detective story!
From the beginning of the game you get all information (newspaper, interviews, links to websites etc.) and then you have to solve the case!

The Carabinieri of Catanzaro need your help: The notorious Tegano Mafia family controls the city and the entire province. But with the death of the eldest son, there is a unique opportunity to put an end to their trade forever.

In this puzzle game, you will receive a case file with evidence, documents and all kinds of clues. Analyze bills, parking tickets, newspaper articles, autopsy reports and much more in order to convict the perpetrator. Use tools like social media profiles and websites to identify motives and check alibis.

Can you solve the case?

- Case files based on real criminal cases
- Interactive elements
- Use other exciting sources such as the Internet
- Put your analytical skills to the test
- Work with your friends

Name: Pocket Escape: Der Schneediamant
Description:
Ready to use anytime, anywhere: The Escape Game puzzle booklet!

There is no question that Miyu Moto, it girl and undercover specialist from the Dyscover detective agency, has to be seen at the penthouse party in the Holden Tower. It's the high society event of the year. But the guests are behaving strangely every minute. Is the new party drug snow diamond to blame? And who distributes the drug among the celebrants? Then Miyu discovers someone in the crowd that she would never have expected at this party ...

28 pages full of puzzles and difficult decisions are waiting for you. Pocket Escape: The snow diamond fits in every pocket - the ideal case for at home or your luggage!

Name: Auksinis protas: Startas Nr. 2
Description:
The game consists of 100 cards with 200 questions, an answer book and 10 joker cards, of which the TV game hosts - ArÅ«nas Valinskas and Andrius Tapinas - will give the players fun QR tasks. You can compete one on one or form teams and embark on a real intelligence fight.
The game begins with the first round of cards (101 to 150 cards and with 5 joker cards) to be shuffled and folded on the table. Cards are drawn in turn, questions are read aloud. If the game is a team based, team members can consult with each other. Answers are checked by the opponent or the opposing team. After playing the first round, the second is played on the same principle (from 151 to 200 cards and with 5 joker cards).
1 point is awarded for the correct answer. For proper performance of the joker's task - 3 points. For transferring a joker card to another player (or team) without reading the QR code - 0 points. After scanning the QR code of a missed task, 1 point is deducted. The participant or team with the most points wins.

The cards can be used as a stand-alone game or as an expansion for "Golden Mind: a great board game". Also, this game can be expanded with "Golden Mind. Start No. 1" cards.

Name: Kriminalkuvert: Ein schweres Erbe
Description:
This a cooperative detective story!
From the beginning of the game you get all information (newspaper, interviews, links to websites etc.) and then you have to solve the case!

Your great-great-uncle, whom you never knew consciously, gave you an inheritance in his will.

You are already excited to see what to expect when only this envelope arrives.

The initial disappointment with the supposedly useless inheritance quickly turns into keen interest when you discover that your relative, a police officer by profession, has left you documents on a criminal case that he apparently worked on unofficially in his spare time.

And with whom he personally had more to do than he should ...

You can buy it here:
https://www.ergoetzlichkeit-shop.com/

Name: Kriminalkuvert: Todesspiel
Description:
This a cooperative detective story!
From the beginning of the game you get all information (newspaper, interviews, links to websites etc.) and then you have to solve the case!

It should have been a happy and conciliatory card game: Six people meet on an island in the tranquil Bad Leckersmoor to spend a sociable evening together. But in the end one of them is dead.

Those present are all valued members of the community: some work on the local council, some are important industrialists.

The law firm entrusted with the estate of the deceased senses inconsistencies and asks you for help.

Name: Japanese: The Game – Fantasy Expansion
Description:
This 36-card Fantasy Expansion Deck brings you vocabulary appropriate to the fantasy realm. Words like “Dragon,” “Magic,” “Treasure,” “Fight,” “Steal,” and “Cast a Spell” are included along with a mix of particles and other words that allow these cards to integrate into a Core Deck without any loss of play balance.

Each expansion to Japanese: The Game adds new vocabulary words, and thus the rules that go along with how each noun, verb, or particle can be placed to make a sentence.

The expansion decks are shuffled in with the main deck to accommodate more players (the game plays 2 by itself and needs either an additional core deck or an expansion to accommodate more), or just to add less common words to the mix for 1-2 players.

Name: Japanese: The Game – Slang Expansion
Description:
This 36-card Slang Expansion Deck brings you vocabulary that is used in a less formal setting. Words like “Cool,” “Hey,” “Gross,” “Lame,” and “Iffy” are included along with a mix of particles and other words and phrases that allow these cards to integrate into a Core Deck without any loss of play balance.

Each expansion to Japanese: The Game adds new vocabulary words, and thus the rules that go along with how each noun, verb, or particle can be placed to make a sentence.

The expansion decks are shuffled in with the main deck to accommodate more players (the game plays 2 by itself and needs either an additional core deck or an expansion to accommodate more), or just to add less common words to the mix for 1-2 players.

Name: Japanese: The Game – Blank Expansion
Description:
This 36-card Blank Expansion Deck brings you blank cards that will allow you to create your cards to integrate with the Core decks. The cards a colored by word type such as “Noun,” “Verb,” “Adjective,” "Adverb," and “Participle” as well as plenty of space to write the Kanji character, description, and example sentence in Japanese. Once all the blank fields have been completed, the cards can be integrated into a Core Deck. There are also 2 cards outlining the Godan Conjugation Table for reference.

This expansion to Japanese: The Game gives you the opportunity to customize your learning experience by adding new vocabulary words that are more specific to your personal needs.

The expansion decks are shuffled in with the main deck to accommodate more players (the game plays 2 by itself and needs either an additional core deck or an expansion to accommodate more), or just to add less common words to the mix for 1-2 players.

Name: Longfish
Description:
Longfish is a children's fish building card game with the goal of creating the longest fish! Elements of memory and push-your-luck to find and build the longest fish.

From a grid, flip over one card at a time to build a complete fish, a complete fish must have one head and one tail and may have two additional middle-body parts. Once a fish is complete you can either take the cards or keep flipping cards to add body parts (push your luck style). If a non-matching fish part is flipped, return all flipped cards face-down (memory style).

Game ends when all 12 fish have been built.
The winner is the one with the most cards.

The game includes 36 playing cards and 4 rule cards.

Longfish can be played in 3 different modes: match, build, and fish.

Name: Crux
Description: Created from a love of both climbing and card games, Crux is a simple yet strategic game to play. The concept is to draw cards to complete your problem while preventing your opponents from doing the same.

Name: ¡Tierra a la Vista!
Description:
Tierra a la Vista is a cooperative game for 2 to 4 players and 40 minute games, where we will become treasure hunters, crew members of a drifting ship trying to return to the mainland with their coffers as full as possible.

The game consists of 2 phases. A planning phase where players will move their characters around the ship collecting action points in the cannons, sails, spyglass, among others, that they will have to collect and then use in the exploration phase.

In the exploration phase, players will take turns drawing cards from the exploration decks trying to get treasures, avoid the weather and defeat the pirates, while they are running out of supplies and the ship suffers damage that will have to be repaired if they do not want to sink. All this using their action points in the best possible way.

The objective is to find in the depths of each deck the three map fragments that will take them back home.
You will win the game if you succeed, and if you have the required amount of treasure in your coffers. But if a crew member drowns, they run out of supplies, or the ship sinks, they will have failed, and their ship will be one more lost in the depths of the sea.

It will not be an easy task. Only cooperation, coordination and teamwork will bring you back.

Beware of Pirates!

The prototype of this game was awarded the "Best New Latin Game" award in the Quarantine Challenge 2020 organized by the game makers community in Mexico.

Name: Meeple Company
Description:
Meeple Company is a strategic worker placement boardgame in which you will have to play your meeples wisely to accomplish your company's three objectives.

You will be able to choose between four types of companies: the laboratory, the toy factory, the robotics company and the chocolate factory. The objectives to be achieved will be the following:

To have a single meeple of your presidency.
To have the highest number of meeples in your main department
To have no prohibited meeples in your company.

To achieve this, you will be able to perform 4 different actions:

Hire: you choose a meeple from those located in the center of the table and place it in your Hall.
Move: you choose one of your meeples and send it to a rival's Hall.
Send to a Congress: you choose a meeple from your work area or from the center of the table and everyone must remove a meeple of that color from their company.
Close: you close your company for this day, you will not be able to perform any more actions or receive any more meeple. The meeples of your Hall go to your work area.

Name: Grindhouse!
Description:
Grindhouse! is a beautifully weird card game for two to four players set in the world of seventies B-movies. By collecting and playing production cards with the requisite values for the genre you're aiming for—and whatever review you're aiming to get—you complete a production and rake in bucks at the box office. Earn more money than your competition and you win the game!

Players collect and play Production Cards onto productions, in separate horizontal rows on the table in front of them, and can work on up to two at a time. There are four different "roles" for Production Cards: Directors (yellow), Actors (blue), On Set (red), and Post (green). Each card has a numeric cost indicating how many cards you must discard to play it on a production and most have one or more value symbols: afros, blood, boobs, buildings, explosions, fists, wheels, and reels.

A production that contains all four roles can be wrapped (completed) by playing a Genre Card and Review Card onto it. Both cards show a value cost—met or exceeded with the value symbols on the Production Cards—and a box office haul for your completed film.

Once a player has wrapped two productions (three in a two-player game), the game ends and box office receipts are totaled and the highest score wins.

Name: LUNA Capital: Promo 1 – Special Sponsor Tiles
Description:
This Promo contains four new Sponsor Tiles for LUNA Capital.: Royal Space Cruise, Astro Burger, Luna Taxis, Moon PAradise Real Estate.

The companies investing in the LUNA Capital project are hard hitters at the top of the game and are willing to do anything to take home the prize.

If you decide to use these Special Sponsor tiles, then at the beginning of the game you will take the Sponsor cards, place them face down, and mix them up. After shuffling them, distribute them randomly to the players and each takes the matching Special Sponsor tile. Each player must put their Sponsor tile on their Sponsor card. To activate these tiles, when the player chooses a Delivery, they may immediately discard one of the Project tiles they just acquired to immediately use their Special Sponsor tile.

The new special sponsor tiles are:

Moon Paradise Real Estate: This tile is placed on the table next to a Building Site on one of the player’s cards that has already been placed (thereby “enlarging” the settlement). Later, the player may place any Project tile on top of it as though it were an empty site. However, it cannot be moved and no Construction card can be placed on top of it. It does not affect any of the restrictions regarding the placement of cards.

LUNA Taxis: When a player places this tile in their Settlement, they may move one of the Project tiles they have already placed to any other empty site in their Settlement, in accordance with the standard placement rules.

Astroburger: When a player places this tile in their Settlement, they may reserve one of the Project tiles that they have taken this turn by putting it on their Sponsor card. They may then place that tile in their Settlement during any subsequent turn, after choosing their Delivery.

Space Royal Cruise: When a player places this tile in their Settlement, they may choose a Construction card in one of the 4 Deliveries and put it into their hand*. Replace the removed card with the top card from the deck.

*NOTE: The printed rules are translated incorrectly to "and place it at the bottom of the deck".

Name: Bitoku: Promo 1 – Gate Tiles
Description: Two new Gate tiles for Bitoku included in the first printrun of the game sold during SPIEL 2021.

Name: Warrior Heroes: To Be King
Description:
A KINGDOM IS YOURS FOR THE TAKING!

Includes color counters and Battle Boards
Your troops are tired and slowly giving ground. They've fought hard all day against an infinite number of enemy troops. They've done all that you've asked of them and more. They've covered themselves with both blood and glory and look to you for victory.

The fate of your nation hangs in the balance as you desperately search for that one spot to launch your final attack. There! Gathering your personal horsemen, you draw your sword for it is now or never. The battle rests on your strong right arm.

Warrior Heroes – To Be King! is set in the mythical world of Talomir and is compatible with our Fantasy RPG, Warrior Heroes – Adventures in Talomir. Talomir is a land where dozens of Nations vie for dominance and like other games, we've provided you with Army Lists that describe your troops and how to assemble them for Battle. Other games allow for fighting individual Battles, but we've taken it farther, much farther.

We’ve added a simple to use, fast play Campaign System that ties all your Battles together to insure that every Battle means something. With the Warrior Heroes – To Be King! Campaign System, you are the Commander of the Army one minute and the King, or Queen, the next.

And best of all; you can play solo, cooperatively against the game, or competitively, head to head.
Do you have what it takes to be King?

–Description from the publisher

Name: 1821: Journey to Freedom
Description:
1821: Journey to Freedom is a fast-paced game in which each player takes on the role of a companion of Kolokotronis, the legendary old man of Morias, on a journey through time, starting with the creation of the Filiki Etereia and ending with the birth of the New Greek state!

The game takes place during the Revolution. 
All the players go through cities and villages, participating in the important historical events that played a key role in the struggle for Freedom.

In the Greece of 1821, based on the memoirs of the Old Man of Moria, we pass through cities, castles and villages, fields of critical battles and political decisions, captures of fighters and places of self-sacrifice and martyrdom, on a journey where memory becomes destination, and destination is experience.

The game takes place in the Peloponnese, the central theater of the Revolution. Each player chooses one of four characters from that period. The choice of character also determines the way the player moves in the game. The Member of the Filiki Eteria, the Philhellene, the Woman of the Revolution and the Revolutionary Fighter of 1821 move inside the board, in order to overcome the obstacles in front of them, to gather supplies and finally to lead to the creation of the Greek Nation.

–Description from the publisher

Name: NASA Home & City Tech Connect Card Game
Description:
The Tech Connect Card Game is an educational game to teach the concepts of the NASA Home and City website (homeandcity.nasa.gov), namely that there are many technologies that NASA developed that help in many parts of society.  It was distributed for free at various events hosted by NASA.

The game is a deck of cards in shrinkwrap and with a cardboard stiffener. Besides the cover and rules cards, there are 12 Target Cards for aspects of life in Home and City (Bedroom, Bathroom, Living Room, Kitchen, Outside; Air Travel, Automotive, Coastal, Grocery, Manufacturing, Medical, Sports), and 48 Tech Cards about various technologies derived from NASA R&D (e.g. UV-blocking glasses, freeze-dried technology, digital cameras, countertop gardens, self-driving farm vehicles), each with a couple of paragraphs of description.

Players take turns being the judge. The judge reveals the top of the Target Card deck. Each other player chooses one of the six Tech Cards in their hand which they think best impacts the revealed target area.  The judge chooses which is the best fit; players can try to persuade the judge why their choice is best.  The player whose Tech Card the judge chooses keeps the Target Card, players draw to replace the Tech Cards played, and the next player is the judge for the next round. The player with the most Target Cards after they are all distributed is the winner.

Name: MathemaChickens
Description:
Acting as an omnivorous chicken that eats almost anything, gobble up the most food points to win.

MathemaChickens is a simple math game where kids use their equation-making skills to eat their way around the farmyard while avoiding the coyote.

How many answers can be formed from two die numbers? 20: 1-10,12,15,16,18,20,24,25,30,36.

Game play is simultaneous, with each player taking turns to roll the dice then making a move.
On each turn …
1. The current player rolls the dice.
2. Moves the coyote. 
3. Players examine the numbers rolled and think of two or more equations using those numbers. (Add, substract, multiply, divide)
4. The rolling player makes the first move, following by the remaining player(s) clockwise.

Name: La guerre d'indépendance de Bretagne (1487-1491)
Description:
The Brittany War of Independence 1487-91 simulates the conflict between the Kingdom of France and the Duchy of Brittany. The war ended with the defeat of the Britons and the marriage of the Duchess Anne to the King of France Charles VIII, sealing the annexation of the Duchy to the kingdom. This game is part of the Gold and Steel series which allows the campaigns of the late 15th and early 16th centuries to be played on a strategic and tactical scale. A combatant counter represents respectively 1,500 to 2,000 pedestrians and 750 to 1,000 riders on the front and half on the back. One artillery counter represents a hundred guns - of all types and calibers.

The game is played over 13 turns corresponding to a season (spring, summer, autumn), the winter turn is not played.
The game puts the French camp in opposition to the Breton camp between which the great Breton lords evolve between betrayal and loyalty; Laval, Rieux Rohan.
This is both a strategic & tactical game with armies and garrisons evolving on the main strategic map. All fighters of this period, such as knights, mercenaries (English bowmen, Gascon crossbowmen, German lansquenets and Swiss pikes), bowmen, billmen, pikes, early arquebusier, country militia, etc., fight on a tactical map featuring a typical XVth century battleground The ambience of that period is added with tactical chits played during the combat rounds (cannon battery, charge, cut and thrust, dismounted knights, ditch, fence, harassment shots, raining arrows) and events such as rain, no fight or betrayal, no wing deployment.
The complete sequence of a turn:
I/ Kingdom of France
1) Reinforcement, replacement
2) strategic move
3) attrition phase
4) combat phase (battles & sieges)
II/ Duchy of Brittany
Same sequence
III/ Diplomatic phase
Check for victory


    5 of the Gold & Steel series
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: I.Q. 2000 Trans Canada Trivia
Description:
This Canadian spin-off of the I.Q. 2000 game, published some time in the mid-1980s, has you navigate across Canada rather than the solar system. It comes with 800 cards (200 per category - History/Geography, Famous People, General Knowledge for Adults, and General Knowledge for Children), each with 5 questions on it, for a total of 4000 trivia questions about Canada and Canadians. It also includes a gameboard with the Canadian map, 6 player pieces (which are stackable if two players land on the same space), 1 die, a plastic storage tray, and instructions.

The object of the game is to be the first player to correctly answer a trivia question after reaching the last circle on the gameboard (in Victoria, British Columbia, Canada). Players take turns rolling the die to move. The color of the space they land on determines which category of question should be asked to them by the player to their right. When children are playing, they can be asked questions only from the easier children's category regardless of which color of space they land on. As long as a player continues answering questions correctly, they get to keep taking more turns. When they get a question wrong, then the player to their left gets a turn. When someone reaches the final space in Victoria, they must answer a final question correctly to win; otherwise, they must move 4 spaces backwards and wait for another turn to try again.

The publisher considers certain topics "integral to the educational aspects of the game", so there is some overlap between the adults' and children's questions, just with different phrasing.

Name: The Dentist
Description:
Do you want to become a dentist and run your own dental clinic? Then, this is your very special game, whether you’re a student or actually a… real dentist. Equip the clinic, hire the best team you can have and let the fun begin.

The Dentist Game, an ideal way to spend your free time and socialize with your friends while you learn new things about dentistry in a more easy and enjoying way. At the very beginning of the game, you have to choose the level of the location interior and waiting room as well as your team of technicians, assistants, students and the starting tools, consumables. After you have put in place all those aspects, you start to upgrade your estates, until you reach the maximum level of 3 for each part of them.

Your managing and economical skills are used to a full extension in this “venue”, so you have all the tools in order to not worry that you have lost your time by the time you get to $10000 (For Your Information: You start with $2000 in your bankroll and the winner is decided by that one person who manages to get to the $10k mark). Time management is also a key factor in this game, so you have to be careful with your game plan, because times means money, right?

Minimum number of required players for the game to be played in a proper way: 2.

Durability of a game that involves at least 4 players: 30 minutes to 1 hour of play-time.

Name: Bear Trap: The Soviet-Afghan War, 1979-1989
Description:
Bear Trap: The Soviet-Afghan War is a quick-playing, low-complexity game simulating the Soviet-Afghan War (1979-1989). Bear Trap adapts the game system from Sekigahara to this new setting.

One player takes command of the ruling Democratic Republic of Afghanistan and its forces, supported by the Soviet 40th Army. The other player takes command of the local tribal rebels (the Lashkar) and Mujahideen guerrilla fighters. The Soviet player seeks to prop up the sympathetic local government and “solve the Russian Ice-lock Problem” while the Insurgent player seeks to expel the foreign invaders and secularist government.

Gameplay consists of alternating turns playing cards to replenish, activate, and move units on an area-based map of Afghanistan, with battles occurring whenever units from both sides end up in the same space. Bear Trap adapts the core mechanics from GMT Games' classic Sekigahara, allowing for the possibility of betrayal and defections, but also adds several new aspects, such as hidden unit stances, powerful strategy cards, and a unique card-assisted solo mode for either side.

Bear Trap is first and foremost a 2-player game, but it also includes rules for solo play (which utilizes a card-assisted flowchart bot).

Time Scale: 16-20 months per Reshuffle
Unit Scale: 1 Block = 500 - 8,000 soldiers
Number of Players: 1 to 2
Play Time: 2 to 3 hours
Complexity: Low (3/9 on GMT's scale)

Name: Doctor Who: Alien Attax
Description:
The Doctor Who TV show reached its 50th anniversary in 2013. The European division of Topps released a collectible trading card game in honor of this, with both a first edition earlier in the year and a 50th Anniversary edition later in the year. It was primarily sold in the UK.

Alien Attax is a simple card game for two players. Each player lays 9 cards face-down. Decide who goes first by flipping a coin. The first player picks their first card and decides whether to attack or defend with it, while it is still face-down. The second player chooses which of their cards to respond with, again while it is still face-down. Then both cards are revealed, and their attack/defence numbers are compared to determine who wins that round. For the next round, the opposite player gets to make the first choice. After all 9 rounds have been played, the person who won the most rounds wins the game.

The first-edition Alien Attax series had 240+ different cards available, and the 50th Anniversary series had an additional 160+ different cards. The 50th Anniversary cards have a grey Tardis '50' symbol in the top right corner of the fronts of the cards. Starter packs were available that included a "Collector Binder", "Collector Guide" with checklist and how to play, and a two-sided paper play mat, in addition to cards. A Collector Tin was also offered with a bundle of cards.

Note: Although 2012 copyright dates are stated on some items, this game was first sold in March 2013.

Name: 18Kit
Description:
18Kit is a modular game designed to scale based on the number of players and choosen lenght of play. Players aim to make the most money by buying and selling stock in different corporation; those entities, conversely, are operated by players and may lay track, place stations, run and buy trains, and distribute returns to its shareholders.
While most 18xx rely on a detailed historical background which shapes the map and companies' starting locations in a fixed way, 18Kit is completely ahistorical and consequently much more flexible.
18Kit features a modular map with up to 7-hex tiles, a "game chart" that defines all aspects of setup depending on player count and bank size, like number of trains, map tiles, available company types.
The game feature a unique ribbon-style hex stock market, which is a variation on the classic 2D stock market.
Other than that, the game is an incremental cap 18xx with minor companies, price protection à la 1870 and 2:1 mergers (systems).
It ends when a player goes bankrupt or the bank breaks, and the winner is the richest non-bankrupt player, taking in account personal money and value of their own shares.

Name: BattleTech: MapPack – Alien Worlds
Description:
Map Pack: Alien Worlds has some of the most unusual terrain yet published in BattleTech, including a fungal crevasse and a caustic valley.

Map Pack: Alien Worlds contains:

     Fungal Crevasse
     Caustic Valley
     Lunar Base
     Crystalline Canyon

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Old West Item Upgrades Pack #1 Game Supplement
Description:
Time to enhance your weapons and items with upgrades like Fur Lining, a Ghost Eagle Feather, or a Mark of Frontier Justice!

This 15-card supplement adds a collection of upgrades to enhance your items from Shadows of Brimstone.

Name: Race! Formula 90: 2nd Edition
Description:
This is the 2nd Edition of Race! Formula 90 including the Base game together with Race! Formula 90: Expansion #1 â€“ RF90 Series Championship and Race! Formula 90: Expansion #2 â€“ Barcelona and Silverstone.

Race! Formula 90 is a car-racing game simulating all the typical elements of a motor sport event: car strategies, weather changes, pit stops, tire management, overtaking, doubling, and of course damages and crashes.

In Race! every game turn represents one or more laps of the track, and each player is in control of only one car. Other cars, called robots, move automatically on the track fighting between them and the human players. Players are provided with a set of racing cards and a car chart to keep track of all available resources (tires, damages, reliability). By playing racing cards, they move along the track and in so doing they spend resources. Movement can be affected by trajectories on the track, straight, corner and braking sections, opponents and other special events like yellow or blue flags.

Strategies and driving skills are another key element of the game. Players must exploit these unique capabilities to gain against competitors while adapting their driving style to the actual race conditions. When using a strategy at his best, a player achieves a "special", which allows him to draw a track card, which is usually more powerful than ordinary racing cards.

This new edition of Race! Formula 90 differs from the original game with a new streamlined set of rules, better balanced strategies and skills, a companion rulebook with optional rules for shorter races, alternative weather system, new type of robot and a different race finish.
All tracks completely redesigned and are circa 20% larger in size
Strategy cards instead of tiles with rule reminders on the back
A general improvement in components.

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: The Scafford Gang Enemy Supplement #3
Description:
The Scafford Gang are one of the most dangerous bands of outlaws in the West! Ruthless Mutants led by Colonel Scafford and his trusty Lieutenants, the Scafford Gang robs trains and towns across the countryside, making their hideouts in the caves and abandoned mines up in the hills. Former Confederates in the Civil War, they despise the law and use their hideous mutations to fill their pockets with gold and Dark Stone.

This set adds new large Enemy Record Sheets for two of the dangerous Scafford Lieutenants: 'Stone Face' McCoy and ‘Silver Back’ Pa Scafford, making them full Enemy mini-bosses. ‘Silver Back’ Pa Scafford is the patriarch of the family and is a new Scafford Lieutenant that did not appear in the Scafford Gang Deluxe Enemy Pack—he debuts in this new Supplement and a new Scafford Lieutenants game card is included for him. This supplement also includes the new 'Old Blunderbuss' Artifact card, as well as a set of new Threat cards that combine various Scafford themed Enemies together, and even Epic Threats to face off against a more dangerous version of each of these Lieutenants with their gang.

This game supplement enhances the Shadows of Brimstone: The Scafford Gang Deluxe Enemy Pack and Shadows of Brimstone: Dark Stone Brutes Enemy Pack, as well as the Resin Enemy Figures for 'Stone Face' McCoy and ‘Silver Back’ Pa Scafford. Those Enemy Packs and resin Miniatures are NOT INCLUDED.

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Scafford Highwaymen Enemy Pack
Description:
Ruthless cutthroats and deadly gunfighters, the Scafford Gang are renowned for being dangerous outlaws, mutated by the black rock. Making their hideouts in the Dark Stone-rich mines around the ruins of Brimstone, the Scafford Gang have been corrupted and twisted by its influence. Of all the gang's members, the Scafford Highwaymen are perhaps the most feared by those traveling the dusty roads and rocky trails through the hills. Cloaked in heavy black dusters that hide their wretchedly mutated forms and wielding powerful shotguns to brutal effect at close quarters, the Highwaymen descend from the cliffs to overtake stagecoaches and trains, leaving a gruesome trail of destruction in their wake!

This Enemy Pack contains everything you need to fend off raids by the ruthless and heavily-mutated Scafford Highwaymen. Included are 6 Scafford Highwaymen models, the large Enemy Record Sheet for them, and all of the Threat Cards needed to add them to your games of Shadows of Brimstone.

This retail set will be available in stores some time next year (2022), but a limited amount of preview copies were we air-freighted in for the Dice Fest 2021 Sale.

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Coffin Breakers Enemy Pack
Description:
Smashing through their wooden coffins and digging their way back to the surface, some undead nightmares refuse to stay in their graves. Known as Coffin Breakers, these skeletal fiends scratch and claw their way out of the rocky ground to bring death and destruction to the world of the living! Armed with rusty graveyard tools as weapons and the splintered remains of their wooden coffins as shields, these deadly foes were once bandits and horse thieves in life, condemned to the grave for their crimes. Now they have risen back from the dead, driven by the cold, unrelenting desire for revenge!

This Enemy Pack contains everything you need to battle the ghastly Undead Coffin Breakers. Included are 6 Coffin Breaker models, the large Enemy Record Sheet for them, and all of the Threat Cards needed to add them to your games of Shadows of Brimstone.

Name: Necromunda Underhive: Delaque Gang Tactics Cards
Description:
This set contains 26 cards for use in your Necromunda games.

It has 18 Delaque cards and 8 blank fighter cards with the House Delaque gang stamp on it.

Name: BattleTech: ilClan
Description: Experience the tumultuous Battle of Terra, which will shake the very foundations of the Inner Sphere. Then catch a glimpse of how the Great Houses and other major powers will face the outcome of this far-reaching conflict. Tactical maps, Chaos Campaign tracks, and new ’Mechs that debuted during the Battle of Terra all let you jump right into the cockpit and fight in the culmination of over three centuries of Clan history. Do you have what it takes to conquer the birthplace of humankind, or the courage to defend Terra from its enemies?

Name: Tyranny of Blood: India's Caste System Under British Colonialism, 1750-1947
Description:
The first place winner of the 2021 Zenobia Awards, Tyranny of Blood models the rise and fall of British colonialism in India from 1750 to around 1947, and the ensuing social displacement—in the religious, military, economic, and labor domains—that still resonate today. The game seeks to answer the lofty questions: how do classes with disparate bases of power work together in a society, how do they struggle against each other, and who are the victims of this process?

In this asymmetric card-driven game, each player plays as one of the four major caste groups (Brahmin, Kshatriya, Vaishya, and Shudra/Dalit) with the end goal of shaping the coming independent Indian nation-state to support their interests while dealing with their unique and unequal places in the hierarchy. Each faction has its own role to play in the game and its own method of earning victory points based on its distinct goals.

In this game, the British are not a playable faction, but a non-player force that players will have to respond to, either by fighting against colonial forces, or working with them to oppose the other players.

Designer note: Tyranny of Blood is about a hierarchical system that has oppressed people throughout history and has lingering effects that continue to cause suffering today. The game is meant as a condemnation of the system and a method of understanding it, not an endorsement or celebration. I hope that learning about this history will inspire players to think critically about the inequalities that plague the world today, and to struggle against them.

Name: BattleTech: MapPack – WWE2018 Terrain Set
Description:
BattleTech MapPacks bring back BattleTech's classic map sheets in printable form. Using the original map sheet art, and sized for compatibility with the original printed sheets and newer Hex Packs alike, you can now store and print as many sheets as needed for your BattleTech games.

Use these sheets in conjunction with the random terrain tables found in Total Warfare, or any time you need a quick map, but transporting physical terrain is impractical. Mount them on poster board or cardboard for longevity, or cut them up to mix and match your own unique battlefields.

Name: Oltréé: "Rats, Rats, Rats"
Description:
This special short scenario is distributed for free as promo goodies at conventions (during SPIEL 21 for example) or with the first orders to celebrate the launch of the game.

Later available during the Dice Tower 2022 Kickstarter Pack A.

Name: Seize the Bean: City Celebrities Customer Expansion Pack
Description:
The City Celebrities Customer Group is a mish-mash of other Customer Groups with diverse requirements and abilities; however, unlike the Quality Beasts and Board Game Media packs, it does not include Award and Upgrade cards.

To quote the "Snack Menu" Expansions ruleboook:
"The City Celebrities are a funny mixture of actually famous, real-life celebrities, fictional characters that are well known to many, and some obscure references that are dear to our hearts. The objective of the Group is to show that being famous in the mainstream is not the only way to earn yourself a fanclub!"

at least 10 customers, 1 customer award / cheat sheet card, 1 promotional card.

Name: Honey Buzz: Fall Flavors
Description:
Sweetwater Grove is all a buzz, with honey on the lips and minds of all the woodland creatures. Thanks to the hard work of accountants like you, the Queen’s honey stand is up and running. But now fall has arrived, and winter is coming! Her Majesty has given Her workers new responsibilities: harvest and sell fruit from the fall crop, decorate the hive with colorful autumn leaves, cap and store nectar for winter, and send retiring workers to be honored at the harvest festival before the sun sets on Sweetwater Grove. So strike up the waggle dance, it’s time for business!

Fall Flavors is an expansion that introduces five new modules for Honey Buzz. You can mix and match to add these modules to the game in any combination!

Fall Fruit Module – Forage in a new field of flowers and collect fruit instead of pollen. Sell your collected apples, pears, and pumpkins at the market or save them up to complete special new orders for honey-dipped fruit.

Autumn Leaves Module – Collect colorful leaves found on the new leafy hive tiles as a means of decorating your hive for the queen. Score points for the leaves in your hive, based on the foliage card in play for that game.

Nectar Caps Module – Put caps on your nectar cells to prepare for winter. Nectar caps are worth lots of points and might even earn you a trophy, but they slow down your economy because capped nectar tiles cannot produce honey!

Harvest Festival Module – Trim your labor force by retiring your workers and sending them off to the harvest festival. As each worker retires, you choose whether they propose a toast or work one last time.

Sweetwater Sunset – When playing with Fall Flavors, use the new sunset board to track progress towards the end of the game. When the sun sets on Sweetwater Grove, winter has arrived, and the game will end.

Name: Mothership: XL Add-On Pack
Description:
Go Extra Large - Beef up your galaxy with a bigger board, new ship colours and massive 8 player games!


     XL Board: Set up your perfect galaxy on a larger, 24" board with new artwork. Connect it with the existing board to go even bigger!
     New Colours: Conquer your enemies in style with new black and silver fleets.
     8 Players: Includes all the needed components to add 2 more players to the game, including extra mineral planets.

Name: huh?
Description:
"huh?" is a game about Boolean logic. It is played with two kinds of cards: "pattern" cards which each have a Boolean function, e.g. "(a or b) and not c," and "epsilon" cards which each contain three out of a set of six letters.

Five games are provided, each of which works the same way: some number of patterns are provided and each player substitutes some of the six letters into one of the patterns to make their secret function. Players take turns selecting an epsilon card from a display and asking another player whether their function produces the result true or false for that card. The object is to be the first to deduce another player's function.

There are also two "pregames" to get players used to Boolean functions.

Name: Insight: The Elements
Description:
In Insight: The Elements, players identify a matching chemical element between two cards.  The periodic table is divided into four blocks (s,p,d,f), each with its own set of cards.

In competitive mode, players aim to find as many matches as they can, as fast as possible.  The fastest and most accurate player wins.  In cooperative mode, players work together to either play all of their cards (laid-back version) or to discard the fewest total cards (strategic version).

The cards are double-sided, allowing for varied difficulty.  One side of each card contains a list of element symbols and their names.  The flip side shows a graphic of a block of the periodic table, with valid elements highlighted.

Name: Une décennie dans les tranchées: Guerre Iran-Irak 1980-1988
Description:
On August 20, 1980, Iraq invaded its neighbor Iran for a limited war with multiple objectives that was promised to be rapid: recover territories that the two powers were fighting over, counter the influence of the Iranian revolution and its leader Ayatollah Khomeini. 
But the offensive quickly bogged down and territorial gains were minimal. 
In 1981, Iran counterattacked and liberated most of its territory in early 1982. Despite a ceasefire, it was Iran's turn to invade Iraq in order to overthrow Saddam Hussein. For another six years the two regional powers would clash for minimal gains.

Une décennie dans les tranchées (A Decade in the Trenches) lets you replay the entire war with a simple system, one-year turns, units representing brigades and divisions, and 80 km hexes.

Published in VaeVictis #159

–description from the publisher
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: The Great Wall: Stretch Goals
Description:
This was the additional stretch goal content given to Kickstarter backers in a separate box.

Contents includes:
5th Player Expansion,
Ancient Chronicles Expansion,
Genghis Khan Expansion, and
Rat Expansion.

Some early bird backers also received the Iron Dragon expansion in this box.

Name: Fairy Trails: Menhir promo card
Description:
The Menhir is a promotional card that helps players to complete one of their paths(and one path of the opponent).

At the start of the game, shuffle the Menhir card together with all other  cards. If the Menhir is placed, any path that connects to the Menhir  counts as completed even if there is (at most) one open connection left.

Name: Praga Caput Regni: Wooden Eggs & Promo Cards
Description:
Promo pack of 5 cards and Wooden Eggs (2 brown, 12 white) to enhance your Praga Caput Regni experience.

Promo cards have no text

Name: First Punic War 264 to 241 BC
Description:
First Punic War 264 to 241 BC is a two-player wargame of the first great military clash between the Roman Republic and the Carthaginian Empire, spanning 24 years in the 3rd century BC. At this time, Rome controlled a federation of states in Italy, while Carthage was the major power of the Western Mediterranean. The war was centered around the island of Sicily, but also saw campaigns in Sardinia and North Africa, with the possibility for more operations elsewhere around the region.

Each game turn (GT) represents three years. Each hex is 40 miles across. Roman combat units represent legions plus attached cavalry (4000 to 5000 men) and groupings of auxiliaries (1000 or more men). Carthaginian units represent groups of various troop types representing 1000 to 10,000 men. Naval units represent about 50 warships each. Leaders represent an inspirational to competent commander plus a guard.

Components: One 22 x 34-inch game map, 176 5/8-inch counters.

Published in S&T #336
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Caporetto: The Italian Front 1917–1918
Description: Caporetto: The Italian Front 1917–1918 is a two-player wargame of the last year of the Italian Front, from the Central Powers’ offensive of the Fall of 1917 until the end of the war in October 1918. In this game, both players command two powerful but fragile forces: the armies of Italy and Austria-Hungary that, in the last year of the war, were at the end of their tether. Each game turn represents 1 month. Each hexagon is 10 kilometers from side to opposite side. Units are divisions, brigades, or equivalents.

Name: Russian Boots South: Conquest of Central Asia
Description:
Russian Boots South: Conquest of Central Asia The game system is based on the previously published S&T games: They Died with Their Boots On, Volumes 1 & 2, Julian, and Sepoy Mutiny.

Russian Boots is a two-player wargame simulating the Russian conquest of Central Asia during the 1850s to 1890s. There are two opposing players: Russian Empire and Khanates. The Russian Empire player represents the theater command of an autocratic empire. The Khanate player represents the various independent kingdoms and tribes of the region, with the possibility of intervention from forces on the periphery. Victory conditions are asymmetrical, with the Russians trying to conquer Central Asia and the Khanates trying to prevent this.

There are three scenarios, each representing a different situation. Each game turn (GT) represents a from one to six years, depending on the pace of operations. Each hexagon on the map represents 80 to 90 kilometers (53 miles). Each Russian unit represents one or two battalion-sized grouping of companies or squadrons. Other units represent brigade or division-sized units, along with corresponding logistics, as well as groupings of tribesmen or other fighters ranging between 1000 to 5000 fighters. Generals represent key commanders, their staffs, and an elite guard.

Components: One 22 x 34-inch game map 176 5/8-inch counters.

Published in S&T #338
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: French & Indian War Battles
Description:
French and Indian War Battles is two player grand tactical wargame system for simulating battles in North America during the French & Indian War (1754-60). While these battles often involved small armies for the era, they decided the fate of the continent.

This game includes three scenarios: Lake George (Sep 1755), Fort Oswego (Aug 1756), and Quebec (Sep 1759).

Each battle has its own map, special rules and counters representing the military formations which participated in the original action. Each game turn represents from 10 minutes to one hour depending on the pace of operations. Each hex represents 50 to 150 yards, depending on the scenario. Combat units represent anything from a wing (two or more companies) to a battalion. Each combat strength point represents 40 to 150 men, depending on the quality of training and weaponry. Each artillery unit represents two to six guns. Leaders represent a single great commander plus staff.

Published in S&T #340
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Return to Europe
Description:
Return to Europe: Sicily & Italy July–Nov 1943 is a Strategic level board-wargame of the Allied invasion of Sicily and Southern Italy. The operation was viewed as only a limited offensive to secure the Mediterranean and force Italy out of the war. The Germans also intended only a limited effort to delay the Allies while a strong defense was established at the far North of the peninsula. Both sides scented greater possibilities in the early going and were drawn into what would become a grueling and expensive campaign.

Using a modified version of rules from Desert Fox Deluxe, one player or team of players commands the Allied forces, the other the Axis. In general terms the Allies are trying to knock Italy out of the war and seize the greatest amount of territory as possible, while the Axis seeks to maintain control of Italian territory for the maximum amount of time.

Each game turn represents one month with up to six player impulses in each game turn.

There are two scenarios, but only the campaign scenario included in the printed rules. The second scenario is included in the PDF version of the rules located at the Decision Games website in the E-Rules section for Strategy & Tactics magazine. http://strategyandtacticsmagazine.com/site/e-rules/

Originally published in Strategy & Tactics magazine #341 - Jul-Aug 2023.

Game Scale:
Game Turn: 1 month
Hex: 6.7 miles / 10 kilometers
Units: Company to Regiment

Game Inventory:
One 22 x 34" full color map
One dual-side printed countersheet (280 1/2" counters)
One 16-page rulebook

Solitaire Playability: Medium
Complexity Level: Medium
Players: 2 or more
Playing Time: 4-10 hours

Note: Players will need to provide two 6-sided die for game play.

Name: Carolingian Twilight: Decline of an Empire AD814
Description:
Carolingian Twilight: Decline of an Empire AD814 is a two to six-player game covering the decline of the Carolingian Empire following the death of Charlemagne (Charles the Great) in AD 814. The Salic Law of the Franks required that at a man’s death, his property was divided among all his sons, which led to civil wars among Charlemagne’s descendants when the inheritance in question was the Empire itself. From the various wills, wars and treaties dividing and redistributing the Empire during the 800s, emerged the nuclei of the modern states of France, Germany, and Italy.

Each of the 10 scenarios depicts the period following a particular division of the empire, with each player taking on the role of one of the heirs. The object of the game is to reunite the Empire under a single ruler, while fending off not only fraternal Frankish rivals, but also the hostile surrounding foreign powers. Each game turn represents 1 year. The map scale is one inch to 75 miles. Each area is an historical region. Each unit represents 100-5000 soldiers (plus camp followers, etc.).

Components: One 22 x 34-inch game map 280 1/2-inch counters.

Published in S&T #342 Sept-Oct 2023.

Name: Operation Albion: Germany versus Russia in the Baltic, 1917-1918
Description:
Operation Albion: Germany versus Russia in the Baltic, 1917-1918 is a two-player operational wargame of the campaign in the Baltic, 1917-18, in which the Germans captured the city of Riga and took critical islands in an amphibious operation. Operation Albion in part led to the collapse of the Russian Provisional Government and brought the final German victory in the East. The campaign was one of the few joint land-naval-air operations of World War I. The game includes the post-Albion German intervention in the Finnish Civil War of 1919.

Albion is a combined naval-air-land campaign. Players conduct actions which encompass discrete combat, logistical, intelligence, and other operations. A player can conduct one or more actions per turn. All units in the game use a similar combat system, showing the interaction of naval, air, and land forces. Each game turn represents from one day to one month depending on the pace of operations. A player may take multiple actions each GT. One inch on the map represents 40 kilometers. Ground units represent regiments, brigades, and divisions, or equivalent formations. Aircraft units represent squadrons. Ship units represent divisions of one to three battleships or battlecruisers, four to eight other cruisers, flotillas of twelve to twenty destroyers, or various numbers of other ships types.

Components: One 22 x 34-inch game map 176 5/8-inch counters

Published in S&T #342
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: GWR: Race to the Ocean Coast
Description:
The Great Western Railway company served southwest England. This game is played on a board showing the lines and towns that could be reached by the company. Players refer to a chart to see where your journey would take you. Movement is by a die. You do not need an exact roll to reach your destinations. The first player to reach Penzanca, Birkenhead, or Fishguard wins the game.

This game is from the 1920s or 1930s.

Name: Max Panic!
Description:
An infectious card game where players fight for a cure and outlast the other players!

Game setup takes roughly 2 minutes. A game of max panic after understanding the simple mechanics takes between 20-30 minutes.

Each player must use the cards in the deck to their advantage. There are 3 card times players must use. Advantage, Protective Gear, and Exposure cards.

Each player has a maximum hand size of 3 cards and will draw one card, play one card each turn. Expose other players to the virus, or give yourself an advantage!

The game is won by having all 3 cure cards or infecting your opponents to 10 Infection Counters.

Name: StegegetS
Description:
StegegetS is a roll and write game set in space. Easy enough for the whole family to enjoy. All players use the same common, beautiful map-sheet for writing and creating a memorable score image.

Roll the 7 dice to get combinations that lets you land on the available planets, moons, and other objects in our solar system. Draw directly on the sheet to show where you go and what you score. When you landed somewhere it becomes your spot, no one else can score for that combination.
When you land you also collect water resources to be able to roll more times and collect points to be able to win. If you want you can use your roll to instead invest in technology, to get various bonuses for the remainder of the game. This makes you more likely to reach the more difficult places to land on in our solar system and find the really high points.

Name: Smarter than a Monkey: Solar System
Description: An expansion dec for the quiz game Smarter than a Monkey. It can be used to replace the questions for any one of the 8 categories in the game. this deck contains questions about the solar system.

Name: Chip Theory Games: Promo Pack 2021
Description:
Chip Theory Games' annual promotion pack for 2021 contains chips and cards for the Too Many Bones and Cloudspire series.
Full content listing:
- Stanza Chip (Game to Pick a Game, usable in Too Many Bones)
- Stanza's 2 alternate attack dice (Game to Pick a Game, usable in Too Many Bones)
- Grim Reaper Nugget (Too Many Bones)
- Truffalo 5pt Baddie Chip (Too Many Bones, created live on CTGTV!)
- Amped Grenades Loot Card (Too Many Bones)
- Luitar Blade Sharpener Trove Loot Card (Too Many Bones)
- Crosspire Landmark Spire Chip (Cloudspire)

Name: Tatort: Das Quiz
Description:
The investigators go on a manhunt. And with them, millions of fans in front of their screens. For over four decades. For over 900 episodes.
High time for a crime scene quiz! Here, die-hard fans can show how well they know their crime scene and put their knowledge to the test.
This quiz box provides 150 entertaining and informative questions and answers about the cult TV thriller.

Name: Field Race
Description: Johnny, Corey, Danny and Barney are at the start for the big farmland race. The course is laid out, everyone has their race tableau, a figure and six tiles. You roll the dice - depending on the result, you place a tile on the diced number on your own tableau and move the figure accordingly - if the number is already occupied, you sit out - or choose a number or move to the next hay bale. Instead of rolling the dice, you can make numbers occupied by tank tiles available again. The player who crosses the finish line for the second time wins.

Name: Mia and me: Gemeinsam für Centopia
Description: The floating island Funtopia and ringmaster Rixel disturb the peace in Centopia, the players must protect unicorns and circus animals from him. 16 squares are laid out according to backs, around them circle tiles with Centopia monives of the squares. You roll the dice; for a color result you uncover one movement square and one motif square and move the figure accordingly. If the move ends on the same motif as on as the uncovered motif square, you may turn over the circle tile you have reached. Rixel as the result of the dice steals one of the eight movement squares with arrow markings on the back. If all the circle tiles are turned over before Rixel has stolen all the arrow tiles, everyone wins together.

Name: Angriff der Drachen: Playmobil Super 4
Description: Dragons of the Black Baron are approaching Knight's Land, the four heroes Ruby, Twinkle, Alex and Gene together with the chameleon collect the equipment. Chips are laid out, around them the Super 4 trays. You roll the dice - for an item you have to hit it with the flicked chameleon, you use a hit alien as a joker; if the chameleon touches a dragon you have to put a dragon chip on a Super 4 tray; if you win an item, you put it on the matching tray; if there is a dragon, it is removed. If there is a dragon on all the trays, the Black Baron has won.

Name: Pentiko
Description: Out of six icosahedrons (20-sided dice), one shows only vowels, one only consonants and the others vowels, consonants and * for jokers. You can roll the dice up to three times and then you have to form a word of the German language with at least three and at most five letters, words with four or five letters may contain one or two jokers. For a five-letter word that also contains a four- and a three-letter word in sequence, you get additional points - e.g. Seite - Seit - Sei. You score points in relation to the number of letters and jokers used. You win with 100 points or after an agreed number of rounds with the most points. A new edition of the game rules allows words with six letters, winning sum 500 points.

Name: Clash of Spears: Rise of Eagles – lists for Rome and its enemies from Marius to Trajan (100BC-100AD)
Description:
Rise of Eagles is an expansion to Clash of Spears

This book expands the forces available in the core book adding 13 new lists.

The lists include the Late Republican Army ( post Marian Reform ), the Early Imperial Army and enemies that fought against  these armies such as Thracians, Germans, Britons, Dacians, Parthians, Spartacus Slave revolt, etc. 
We have also included the eastern enemies that Rome fought during the times of the Republic such as the armies of the successors of Alexander the Great or the Pontic kingdom.

All in all this is a great complement to your core book multiplying the lists and periods in which you can set up your games.

–Description from the publisher

Name: Risen Osiris
Description:
Help Isis resurrect her slain husband, Osiris and defeat the chaos and destruction of Set.

Solo player micro-roll & write playable in less than 10 minutes. Easy Difficulty.

This game was an entry in the 2017 Solo Game Contest.

Name: Qube: Finurligt med Astrid
Description: Trivia game about Astrid Lindgren and her books. Each player is dealt five cards with question categories. Answering the question right allows player to discard that card. First player without cards is the winner.

Name: Who is Who?
Description:
Similar to Guess Who?, but with full length characters carrying various items. One of the characters is selected, and players take turns asking questions to try to guess which one.

From the publisher: There are 50 characters to choose from. Players compete to be the first to guess which one is pictured on The Who is Who card in play. As questions are asked and answered, characters can be removed from the board, narrowing the choices.

In the advanced rules players don’t remove characters from the board.

Name: Ten To One
Description:
The French colony of Saint-Domingue produced more wealth than the rest of France's colonies combined. France chose to meet the demand for these labor-intensive crops by way of an explosive increase in slavery with nearly half a million enslaved West Africans working the Saint-Domingue plantations. The brutality and greed of the plantation owners and overseers, coupled with the extreme disregard for the enslaved Africans' humanity, set the stage for revolt. After months of hidden preparation, the signal was given following a secret Vodou ceremony. On the 21st of August, 1791, the fuse to the powder keg that was Saint-Domingue ignited with the flame of liberation.

In the cooperative deck-building and strategic war game Liberation - Haiti. the players each control a geographical faction of enslaved Africans or those who escaped enslavement living in the French colony of Saint-Domingue during the early period of the Haitian Revolution, 1791 to 1793. These factions seek both the abolition of their slavery and social equality.

Before rebelling and fighting for your liberty, you need to recruit people to your cause, gather information, develop maneuvers, and stockpile supplies, all while the game is opposing your actions. You have to face well-armed colonial militia and foreign armies, navigate fragile or fleeting alliances, and overcome both political and environmental challenges to win freedom for your people.

The game is played in two stages: the Planning Stage and the Revolution Stage. In the Planning Stage, you use a deck of cards specific to your faction to acquire planning cards that represent intelligence, people, and materiel. Cards added to your pool will in turn help accumulate more and stronger cards of these types. In the Revolution Stage, you use your acquired card pool to overthrow the colonial slave system by deploying units to raid plantations, defeat enemy forces, seize control of strategic locations, increase the morale of your people, and meet political challenges.

Name: The Royal Trials
Description: A quick and light RPG style card game where the player builds up their character, gaining powers and equipment, over the course of facing down a series of rivals. It can be played solo, cooperative, or competitive with nothing more than a set of playing cards and two six-sided dice per player.

Name: Weekend Warriors: The Ultimate Tabletop Skirmish Game To Play With Your Kids
Description:
Weekend Warriors is the ultimate tabletop skirmish game to play with your kids! 
It’s a fast-paced, action-packed tabletop skirmish game that is fun to prepare and play together. 
The rules are simple and quick to learn but provide enough depth to keep the bigger kids just as immersed and entertained! 
Learn the rules once and then apply them to any genre.

You can use any models to represent your warriors, from construction toys to paper drawings to your favourite plastic or metal miniatures. Then all you need is a measuring tape, gauge or ruler, some six-sided dice, and a keen imagination.

Set your game in any setting; Sci-fi, fantasy, historical, modern or zombie-infested apocalyptic wastelands; it's up to you. Tell your story your way as you develop adventures based on your interests. Weekend Warriors gives you a framework to build your stories around as you prepare and play your game.

As you take control of the narrative and choose which rules to use and which ones to leave out, it’s great for any age. But the game is perfect for children aged 7+ when all the rules are in play.

A big part of the game is choosing your band of warriors. This is where your imagination can be let loose as you create your Warband and equip them with the gear and skills they need to succeed in battle.

This book gives you everything you need to create epic adventures with your friends and family. 
So that leaves one question. 
Are you ready to accept your destiny and become a Weekend Warrior!?

–description from the publisher

Name: Memorace: Gyerekjáték a matematika
Description:
One minute is not the world, right? Do you think so even if you have even less time to memorize every detail of an image? Memorace board game amusingly develops not only memory but also general knowledge and literacy. Learning becomes a captivating experience with its tasteful illustrations. How good is your memory?

Immerse yourself in the cards and discover the ingenious connections of math! Sphere, right angle, parallel, symmetrical ... If you don't already speak the language of math, these words may sound scary. But you won’t even notice, and with the help of the cards, every concept will fall into place!

You can play Memorace alone or with more people.
1.Draw a card and put it in front of you!
2.Turn the clock over and try to memorize as many details as possible before the sand drips off - it’s about 10 seconds.
3. Throw the dice!
4.If you rolled 1, you must answer the thought-provoking puzzle on the front panel. Look at the picture and calculate or deduce correctly!
5.If you did not roll 1, turn the card over and answer the question on the back next to the rolled number. These will put your memory to the test, but if you watch well, you will know the answer for sure!

There’s no reason to get frustrated even if you didn’t know the answer, turn the card over and find the solution! However, if you answered correctly, you can keep the card - congratulations, you already have a point!
Who will collect the most cards? Can you break your own record?

Name: Memorace: Fedezzük fel Európát!
Description:
One minute is not the world, right? Do you think so even if you have even less time to memorize every detail of an image? Memorace board game amusingly develops not only memory but also general knowledge and literacy. Learning becomes a captivating experience with its tasteful illustrations. How good is your memory?

Wander through the wonderful landscapes of the old continent and get to know the culture of the countries!

You can play Memorace alone or with more people.
1.Draw a card and put it in front of you!
2.Turn the clock over and try to memorize as many details as possible before the sand drips off - it’s about 10 seconds.
3. Throw the dice!
4.If you rolled 1, you must answer the thought-provoking puzzle on the front panel. Look at the picture and calculate or deduce correctly!
5.If you did not roll 1, turn the card over and answer the question on the back next to the rolled number. These will put your memory to the test, but if you watch well, you will know the answer for sure!

There’s no reason to get frustrated even if you didn’t know the answer, turn the card over and find the solution! However, if you answered correctly, you can keep the card - congratulations, you already have a point!
Who will collect the most cards? Can you break your own record?

Description:

Memorace board game amusingly develops not only memory but also general knowledge and literacy. Learning becomes a captivating experience with its tasteful illustrations. How good is your memory?

One of the great parts of the Memorace board game series is Magic Tales. The child can cross the threshold of the fairytale world, meet their favorite fairytale heroes and learn about new ones. Was the princess blonde or brown haired? What color was the ladybug? How many wolves stood with their backs to the picture?

The point is that not the smallest detail escapes our attention and success is not left behind.
You can play Memorace alone or with more people.
1.Draw a card and put it in front of you!
2.Turn the clock over and try to memorize as many details as possible before the sand drips off - it’s about 10 seconds.
3. Throw the dice!
