There’s no reason to get frustrated even if you didn’t know the answer, turn the card over and find the solution! However, if you answered correctly, you can keep the card - congratulations, you already have a point!
Who will collect the most cards? Can you break your own record?

Name: Memorace: Ismerkedjünk a matekkal!
Description:
One minute is not the world, right? Do you think so even if you have even less time to memorize every detail of an image? Memorace board game amusingly develops not only memory but also general knowledge and literacy. Learning becomes a captivating experience with its tasteful illustrations. How good is your memory?

The child can take the first steps in the wonderful world of math and playfully learn the realm of numbers.

You can play Memorace alone or with more people.
1.Draw a card and put it in front of you!
2.Turn the clock over and try to memorize as many details as possible before the sand drips off - it’s about 10 seconds.
3. Throw the dice!
4.If you rolled 1, you must answer the thought-provoking puzzle on the front panel. Look at the picture and calculate or deduce correctly!
5.If you did not roll 1, turn the card over and answer the question on the back next to the rolled number. These will put your memory to the test, but if you watch well, you will know the answer for sure!

There’s no reason to get frustrated even if you didn’t know the answer, turn the card over and find the solution! However, if you answered correctly, you can keep the card - congratulations, you already have a point!
Who will collect the most cards? Can you break your own record?

Name: Even Monsters Get Spooked
Description:
A Halloween themed card game where you draft spooky creatures into your hand, get them hopped on as much candyy as possible, to make them as scary as all get out, in order to spook your opponents into submission.

The player who takes 3 tricks, wins.

Name: Knock Knock Jr.
Description:
A fast-paced, competitive game for friends and families.
This is a reimplentation of Knock Knock, but with fewer suits and a bit less take-that. It is, as described, a family game to be played with kids. 
The remainder of the description is via the publisher's description of Knock Knock:
In this card game players compete to be the first to get rid of their hands.
Like other card shedding games, play proceeds as players discard matching the suit or value of the previously discarded card.
Various special cards also add fun and silly elements such a slapping, nose touching and moose antlers.

Name: The Fall of Kings
Description:
The Fall of Kings is an asymmetric worker placement game that focuses on 4 different organizations that are determined to perform their duties better than the others.

You take control of one of four unique factions; the Town Guard, the Doctor's Consortium, Paladin's Order and Tax Collectors and you must perform each faction's unique actions on the surrounding towns of the kingdom in order to progress the fame of your organization.

Through your actions, you may be able to impact other factions such as poisoning the village that is about to get visited by the Tax Collector or curing a town of their diseases as the Paladin Order, before the corrupt Consortium has a chance to cash in on their own doing.

The King can influential the performance of the factions in multiple ways; through the alteration of income for each faction or through the fame bonuses given to them. But most organizations have the ability to contract assassins to remove the King, hoping the next one in succession will benefit them and their faction.

Name: Neko Harbour: The Card Game – Ghost Ship
Description:
The Ghost Ship mini-expansion for Neko Harbour: The Card Game. The expansion contains four ghost ship cards. Ghost ships costs two fuel to move, and cannot move to an attraction. They are worth seven points if they reach the end of the preparation line.

—user summary

Name: Generic Board "Square"
Description: A set of a board and pieces for unspecified abstract strategy games. The board is printed on both sides and corresponds to the six sizes common in classic abstract games. As appendixes, it comes with the rules for five games in the public domain, Konane, Fox and Hounds, Tafl, Halma, Turkish Checkers, and author's three original games of Mabi, Tiptoe and Apart which can be played on this board.

Name: Generic Board "Hexagonal"
Description: A set of a board and pieces for unspecified abstract strategy games. The board is printed on both sides and corresponds to the three sizes common in modern abstract games. As appendixes, it comes with the rules for the author's eight original games, Stoic, Stride, Squish, Unlace, Skirt, Node, Orochi and Sibling which can be played on this board.

Name: Paw Patrol: The Adventure City lookout
Description: Mayor Humdinger planned an Adventure City celebration that (as usual) has been ruined by a storm. Even worse, he's also putting lonely pups in obedience school! Use your mission card to see what items to find around city. Once the items are found, you can rescue the lovely pups!

Name: Krobe
Description:
Krobe is a game that can be played alone or with others.
From 6 years old and over. For games of about 10 minutes.

Krobe revisits the famous game of Memory in a cooperative mode where all the players are on the same team. It takes a playful approach to a hot topic: microbes.
Small but not that cute, germs are everywhere. Use your expertise and intuition to fight contamination.

The objective of the game is to find Patient Zero or save 8 pairs of inhabitants before the team's health is completely degraded.

Name: Maximum Apocalypse: Promo Cards
Description:
3 new characters

German version:
- Verrückter Feuerwehrmann - Alle Spieler werfen alle Suchkarten aus ihrer Hand ab.
- Revolverheldin - Füge bis zum Ende deines Zuges 2 Schaden zusätzlich zu.
- Jäger - Ziehe 1 Suchkarte von 1 beliebigen Stapel.

English version:
- Crazed Fireman (Boss) - Short Range - Draw: Player must discard all scavenge cards from their hands.
- Gunslinger - Red's Rage - Action: Increase all damage by 2 until the end of your turn.
- Hunter - Scavenge - Action: Draw a scavenge card from any deck.

Name: Risen Osiris: Sacred Numbers
Description:
A mini expansion to the micro solo roll & write game, Risen Osiris. Select a card and incorporate into the base game using the same dice rolling mechanic.

---   
Instructions:

Using numbers that were considered powerful  by the ancient Egyptians, these cards are meant  to add some more variety to Risen Osiris gameplay.

Select any card from the expansion and cover the  boxes under the Canopic Jars location and roll for the new numbers in the expansion boxes as normal.

Exception: In Sacred Fours, when rolling 12s, you can  place a cube in the corresponding Canopic Jar instead of moving a yellow cube to Set’s Pyramid.

Name: Sternenspiel
Description:
Players begin on the red outer lane. Each players rolls dice and moves along the outer lane. If you end your turn on a black star, you can switch to the yellow inner lane on the next turn. If your token meets an occupied space there, you must switch back to the red outside lane. Pieces on yellow stars may not be captured, but can be on black stars.

The first player to move all of his stones to the central star wins the game.

A variant of "Mensch ärgere dich nicht".


Variante von "Mensch ärgere dich nicht".
Gewürfelt wird reihum. Wer seinen Zug auf einem schwarzen Stern  beendet darf im nächsten Zug auf die gelbe Innenbahn wechseln. Wenn sein Spielstein dort auf ein besetztes Feld trifft, muss er wieder auf die rote Außenbahn wechseln. Spielsteine auf gelben Feldern dürfen nicht geschlagen werden, auf schwarzen Feldern ist dies aber möglich.
Wer zuerst alle seine Steine auf den zentralen Stern befördert hat gewinnt das Spiel.

Name: Blood in the Valley: Campaign Supplement
Description:
This is a supplement for the main rulebook “Blood in the Valley”.

You will be able to conduct campaigns with your armies and fight multiple battles! This Campaign Supplement is D6 based.

You will feel like an American Civil War General commanding your armies and leading them to battlefield glory!

This Supplement is available at WargameVault as a pdf download!

Name: Space Base: The Mysteries of Terra Proxima
Description:
A New addition to the galaxy and A New Way to Expand Your Game!

Merging the power of Shy Plutonium with new starship technologies has allowed the U.E.S. Science Corps to reach the distant stars of Alpha Centauri, and discover the planet Terra Proxima. Strange ruins and vast fields of fungi cover much of the planet. Eager for knowledge, the U.E.S. authorizes colonization!

Welcome to the second installment of Space Base™ Saga Expansions. This is a collection of games with a linked story that introduce new content to Space Base™ via a narrative are included as well. Once the story is completed, it may be structure. Not only are new ships added, but new scenarios replayed or the contents may be added to your Space Base™ core set.

—description from the publisher
